text: Wall Street's main indexes opened slightly lower on Friday as energy stocks slipped and investors digested recent gains driven by stimulus bets and accelerated vaccine roll outs, ahead of the long weekend.The Dow Jones Industrial Average (.DJI) fell 9.9 points, or 0.03%, at the open to 31420.8. The S&P 500 (.SPX) fell 4.7 points, or 0.12%, at the open to 3911.65, while the Nasdaq Composite (.IXIC) dropped 46.6 points, or 0.33%, to 13979.213 at the opening bell.
